titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lance Hidy Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Arts of the Book Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 22, 2019 at 23:00

did.abstract: The Lance Hidy Collection documents the process of book design and illustration through correspondence, proofs, and other ephemera. Of particular note is the documentation of Losing Things at Mr. Mudd's , the first children's picture book to be created on the computer. The collection also contains a good representation of poster designs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lance Hidy Collection, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lance Hidy '68 works as a graphic designer. His colorful style is widely recognized in posters and books and even a stamp, "Mentoring a Child," for the U.S. Postal Service in 2002. Hidy has worked for a long list of clients, including the Library of Congress, Boston Symphony Orchestra, Children's Memorial Hospital, Chicago, Adobe, and Eastman Kodak, as well as Yale University. Hidy has also taught graphic design at various institutions, including Boston University and the Corcoran School of Art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lance Hidy Collection documents the process of book design and illustration through correspondence, proofs, and other ephemera. Of particular note is the documentation of Losing Things at Mr. Mudd's , the first children's picture book to be created on the computer. The collection also contains a good representation of poster designs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Lance Hidy's Posters: Designs Personal & Public , 1981-1988. II. Losing Things at Mr. Mudd's , 1987-1991. III. Moral Reflections on the Short Life of the Ephemeron , 1967. IV. Other Posters, Proofs, and Prints, 1973-1991. V. Correspondence and Ephemera, 1966-1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains additional graphic works by Hidy, including examples of printed ephemera executed while Hidy was a student in Jonathan Edwards College at Yale University. The series also contains some correspondence written by Hidy.

did.unittitle: Various printed ephemera, including concert programs for Jonathan Edwards College, etc.

Various printed ephemera, including concert programs for Jonathan Edwards College, "Assurances" by Walt Whitman, "We are all brothers," and "Season's Greetings 1966" envelope and booklet for Boise Cascade Corporation, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder also contains correspondence from Hidy to Dale Roylance, Curator of the Graphic Arts Collection at Sterling Memorial Library, as well as two small maquettes for Moral Reflections on the Short Life of the Ephemeron and for A Free-Thinker by Bishop Pearce.

did.unittitle: Various printed ephemera, including concert programs, a menu, and other jobs printed for Jonathan Edwards College

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder also contains correspondence from Hidy to Dale Roylance.

did.unittitle: Promotional materials for Lance Hidy's Posters: Designs Personal & Public
Promotional materials for Lance Hidy's Posters: Designs Personal & Public

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains two fliers for "The Return of the Poster," a slide lecture given by Lance Hidy at the Boston Public Library, December 6, 1983.

did.unittitle: [Six Months - Hidy] Various printed ephemera, including bookplates, graphic works for Jonathan Edwards College, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder also contains the following: photocopies of newspaper clippings about Hidy's work; promotional materials for Lance Hidy's Posters ; and proofs and original sketches for "The Mayfly" as well as the May 1967 issue of The Yale Literary Magazine that featured "The Mayfly" by Lance Hidy.
